title: Cupcake magazine title. Please help, it's urgent!
author: EliseBunt

comments.content:
I wonder if this could be hand-drawn. There is an unevenness in the letter heights that I wouldn't expect in a font, and I couldn't find this at a freebie site (where such things often show up).

Maybe someone else recognizes it?

- Mike Yanega

I think it's Nick Curtis' [Quigley Wiggly](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826133911/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/curtis/pages/q_r.htm) - his version of [Holly Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826133911/http:/old.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/holly-script/).

Quigley Wiggly has the same uneven x-height of the 'a' and 'e', but Holly Script does not. The C is also strange in Holly but was cleaned up by Nick (maybe the URW version is messed up?).

- Mike Yanega

Elise - You are ceratinly welcome.

Mike - I think that vertical line in the C is supposed to be consistent with similar thin vertical strokes in other caps. It's present in Dan Solo's Dover version as well as knockoffs. It does look odd in the C, though.
